Pre-Game Insights: David Peterson has been especially good in August, throwing 31.2 innings with a 1.71 ERA, allowing just 23 hits and one home run.
Peterson forces opposing teams to hit ground balls frequently, and the Diamondbacks have a high ground ball rate, which could be advantageous for him.
Ryne Nelson has been strong since July, with a 4-0 record and a 2.62 ERA in 62 innings, helping the Diamondbacks to an 8-2 record in those starts.
The Diamondbacks have a strong batting average and slugging percentage, which could help them take advantage of Peterson's higher ground ball rate.
